SELF_DESCRIPTION: A Master's Student at Stanford University

DESCRIPTION: I am a master's student in Electrical Engineering at Stanford University. My interests include software development and web programming. I am currently seeking internship opportunities in Software Engineering for the summer of 2024.

Before attending Stanford, I earned my B.S. and M.S. degrees in Electrical Engineering from National Taiwan University. During my undergraduate studies, I had the privilege of working with Prof. Eric Y. Chuang on software development in the field of cancer genomics. During my master's program, I collaborated with Prof. Chung-Yang Ric Huang on quantum circuit optimization and software framework development.

Undergraduate student & researcher.LAB: Electrical Engineering department Bioinformatics and biostatistics Core, NTU

PROJECT_PAGE.name: ❖ Qsyn: An End‐to‐End Quantum Circuit Synthesis Framework
des: ➣ Qsyn is a C++ based growing software system for synthesis, optimization and verification of quantum circuits appearing in quantum computers. Qsyn implements scalable quantum circuits optimization by combining ZX-Calculus and technology mapping

➣ Qsyn provides an experimental implementation of optimization algorithms and a programming environment for simulation or building similar applications. Future development will focus on enhancing the algorithms, and visualization of ZX-graphs

PROJECT_PAGE.name: ❖ Wordle
des: ➣ The exam designed for 111-1 NTUEE Web programming Hackathon1

PROJECT_PAGE.name: ❖ MineSweeper
des: ➣ The exam designed for 110-1 NTUEE Web programming Hackathon1

PROJECT_PAGE.name: ❖ SKRIK: A Simultaneously and Co-edited Coding Website
des: ➣ An online code editor which provides multiple users to edit the same project simultaneously

PROJECT_PAGE.name: ❖ NTUEE+ Website
des: ➣ Built a complete network of NTUEE’s alumni and deepened the connection between NTUEE students
➣ The services contain member verification, alumni’s interview to provide latest industrial information, recruitment information, and a self-recommendation system

PUBLICATIONS_PAGE.year: NAR genomics and bioinformatics, vol. 3, no. 4, lqab099, 2021
PUBLICATIONS_PAGE.title: MutScape: an analytical toolkit for probing the mutational landscape in cancer genomics
des: We developed a user-friendly Python toolkit, MutScape, which provides a comprehensive pipeline of filtering, combination, transformation, analysis and visualization for researchers, to easily explore the cohort-based mutational characterization for studying cancer genomics when obtaining somatic mutation data.

HONORS_PAGE.title: ❖ Honorable Mention Award
